markdown:
<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">[Summon Instrument](/Spells.aspx?ID=721)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Three Actions" /></row>
<row>[material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You materialize a [handheld musical instrument](/Equipment.aspx?ID=37) in your grasp. The instrument is typical for its type, but it plays only for you. The instrument vanishes when the spell ends. If you cast _summon instrument_ again, any instrument you previously summoned disappears.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The instrument is instead a virtuoso handheld instrument.
name: Summon Instrument

text: Summon Instrument Source Advanced Player's Guide pg. 226 2.0 Traditions Divine, Occult Cast Three Actions material, somatic, verbal Duration 1 hour --- You materialize a handheld musical instrument in your grasp. The instrument is typical for its type, but it plays only for you. The instrument vanishes when the spell ends. If you cast summon instrument again, any instrument you previously summoned disappears. --- Heightened (5th) The instrument is instead a virtuoso handheld instrument.
